page.title: 17R.A.F Halton and Village
page.content: The R.A.F dominates the Halton scene as a technical training centre for apprentices who move on to operational stations. The small airfield accomodates light aircraft and a popular gliding club. An important annual event is the Halton Air and Motor Show which often includes the famous Red Arrows Air Display Team. Princess Mary's hospital contains centres for tropical diseases and dentistry. The village itself, centred around St.Michael's Church, provides dormitory accommodation for camp personnel. It still retains its original charm,in spite of in-filling since 1975 but there are no pubs or shops. The annual fete is still the most popular fund raising event.
